summary:
• Julian Assange has landed in Australia as a free man.
• His wife says he needs time to recuperate.
• He had been fighting extradition for a decade.

• Bolivian police arrest leader of coup attempt
• Bolivian soldiers storm plaza; former general accused of coup attempt

• A cable car fell from its station in Colombia.
• One person was killed as a result.
• An investigation is underway to determine cause of incident.

• A French court has confirmed an arrest warrant for Syrian President Bashar al-Assad in connection with the 2013 Syria chemical attack.
• The court's decision comes after allegations that Assad was responsible for the attack, which killed hundreds of people, including many civilians and children.
• This move marks a significant step towards holding those accountable for human rights abuses during the Syrian conflict.

• Former Honduran president convicted of drug trafficking.
• Sentenced to 45 years in prison.
• Crime involved smuggling drugs from Honduras to the US.

• The Indian cricket team's performance in the World Cup may mark the end of an era for their aging batting lineup.
• The tournament could be a farewell event for some of India's most experienced players.
• This speculation is fueled by concerns about the team's ability to adapt to changing circumstances without its veteran leaders.

• Iran selects its new president.
• The election process determines who will hold the office.
• The chosen candidate will be responsible for leading the country.

• Israel accuses UN of contributing to Gaza's aid crisis due to fresh reports of severe food shortages.
• The Israeli Supreme Court has ruled that ultra-Orthodox individuals must participate in military service.
• The Israeli government faces criticism from the international community regarding its handling of the Gaza Strip conflict.

• Kenya's President withdrew his tax plan due to violent protests.
• Protesters in Nairobi set fire to Parliament amid clashes with police.
• A live BBC report was briefly disrupted by a gunman in Nairobi.

• $100 million worth of assets linked to the Malaysian Development Bank (1MDB) will be repatriated back to the country.
• This move marks a significant step towards addressing corruption allegations surrounding 1MDB's management of public funds.
• The return of these assets is expected to have a positive impact on Malaysia's economy and financial stability.

• The US and the Philippines aim to calm tensions
• A recent incident involving China sparked the need for diplomacy
• Both nations want to reduce hostilities in the disputed area

• Ukraine replaces top general amid war setbacks.
• General's departure sparks speculation about new military strategy.
• Government seeks to revamp its leadership team amidst criticism over performance.

• Russia, China, and India's reactions to the US presidential election.
• The first debate between Joe Biden and Donald Trump is imminent.
• A disabled man was rescued from a burning house by police.
• The Supreme Court has allowed abortion services in Idaho.
• Paris Hilton testified to the US Congress about her experiences with child abuse.
• A house fell into a river due to a dam failure in the US.
• Illegal border crossing have decreased since Biden implemented stricter rules.
• Julian Assange pleaded guilty to an espionage charge.
